alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 5:49PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Albany County through 630 PM MDT... At 548 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Bosler, or 20 miles northwest of Laramie, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bosler around 630 PM MDT. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 289 and 295. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills
